channel.title: OMG! Ubuntu!
channel.description: An Ubuntu blog bringing you the latest Ubuntu news, apps, interview and reviews, daily.

item.title: Pinta Image Editor Gets First Update in 5 Years
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Pinta image editor has made its first release in over 5 years. The revived Mono-based graphics app adds new features and fixes long-standing bugs.

This post, Pinta Image Editor Gets First Update in 5 Years is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: LibreOffice 7.0 Released, This is What’s New
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
LibreOffice 7.0 is here, serving as the latest stable release of this hugely popular open source productivity suite. As you’d expect, LibreOffice 7.0 boasts a raft of improvements and notable new features aimed at firming […]

This post, LibreOffice 7.0 Released, This is What’s New is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Flash ISOs to Multiple USB Sticks on Linux with Popsicle
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
If you’re looking for an easy way to flash install images to multiple USB sticks in parallel check out Popsicle. This handy tool, which is written in Rust, lets you write an .iso (or other […]

This post, Flash ISOs to Multiple USB Sticks on Linux with Popsicle is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Linux Marketshare Dipped in July, But Not By Much!
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
If you were hoping July would yield another bumper month for Linux marketshare I'm here to gently shake you awake and waft an aromatic espresso under your nose.

This post, Linux Marketshare Dipped in July, But Not By Much! is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Native 1Password Linux App is Now Available for Testing
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
The official 1Password Linux app is now available to test. The new Rust-based Linux 1Password client lets you sync passwords with other OSes and devices.

This post, Native 1Password Linux App is Now Available for Testing is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Linux 5.8 Released, This is What’s New
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
The Linux Kernel 5.8 release has been announced – but what's new and improved? In this post we recap all the neat new features and core changes on offer.

This post, Linux 5.8 Released, This is What’s New is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: You Can Now Run Mac OS 8 on Linux as an Electron App
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Fancy running Mac OS 8 on your modern Mac, Linux, or Windows 10 desktop as a standalone app? Of course you don’t 😉 but that hasn’t stopped Slack developer Felix Rieseberg from giving you (and […]

This post, You Can Now Run Mac OS 8 on Linux as an Electron App is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: How to Make Telegram’s Linux App Use System Window Frame
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
A recent update to the Telegram desktop client for Linux introduces a “new” non-native window frame by default. The new window decorations look flat, narrow, and a bit Windows 10-y. Which is to say: it’s […]

This post, How to Make Telegram’s Linux App Use System Window Frame is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Mozilla Firefox 79 Released, This is What’s New
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Mozilla Firefox 79 is available to download for Windows, macOS and Linux. The new build makes adds tab page tweaks, better tracking protection, and more.

This post, Mozilla Firefox 79 Released, This is What’s New is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Improve Firefox Performance on Linux by Turning WebRender On
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Learn how to enable WebRender in Firefox on Linux. This new tech can deliver a major performance boost by using your system's GPU to render web content.

This post, Improve Firefox Performance on Linux by Turning WebRender On is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Enlightenment 0.24.2 Released with Bug Fixes, Updated Terminal App
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
I'm not entirely sure why I write about new releases of the Enlightenment desktop as and when they materialise, but I do — and a new one is here!

This post, Enlightenment 0.24.2 Released with Bug Fixes, Updated Terminal App is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: DigiKam’s Improved Face Detection for Photos Even Works on Animals
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
AI powered face recognition is just one of the new features in DigiKam 7.0, the latest version of this open source photo management software.

This post, DigiKam’s Improved Face Detection for Photos Even Works on Animals is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: The 3rd-Gen KDE Slimbook is Here, And Boy is it Powerful
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
The all-new third-generation KDE Slimbook is now available to buy from— and on paper it looks a beast. Hiding inside its thin and light magnesium alloy case is a powerful AMD Ryzen 4000 processor, ample […]

This post, The 3rd-Gen KDE Slimbook is Here, And Boy is it Powerful is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: TUXEDO Pulse 15 is a New AMD-Powered Linux Ultrabook
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Looking for a powerful Linux workstation taking advantage of AMD chips? Look no further than the Pulse 15 from TUXEDO Computers which uses Ryzen 4000 chips.

This post, TUXEDO Pulse 15 is a New AMD-Powered Linux Ultrabook is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: SuperTuxKart’s Next Release is Available for Testing
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
SuperTuxKart 1.2 is the latest update to the popular open source kart racer. We look at the new features, key changes, and show you where to download it.

This post, SuperTuxKart’s Next Release is Available for Testing is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Glimpse 0.2.0 Beta Available for Testing
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
A new beta release of Glimpse, the rebranded GIMP fork, is available for testing. Glimpse 0.2.0 is based on GIMP 2.10.18 and includes most of its features.

This post, Glimpse 0.2.0 Beta Available for Testing is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Thunderbird 78 Released with OpenPGP Support, Integrated Lightning Calendar
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Thunderbird 78 is the latest stable release of the email client. It features OpenPGP encryption support, integrated calendar, and dark mode support.

This post, Thunderbird 78 Released with OpenPGP Support, Integrated Lightning Calendar is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Get GNOME 3.38’s New Default Wallpapers Right Now
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Here's your first look at GNOME 3.38's new default wallpaper, plus a link to download it to use on your own desktop ahead of September's GNOME 3.38 release.

This post, Get GNOME 3.38’s New Default Wallpapers Right Now is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: GNOME Opens an Official Merch Shop Selling T-Shirts, More
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
GNOME fans can now buy t-shirts, hoodies, and even socks bearing the famous logo through a new, dedicated online store. We take a look at what's on offer…

This post, GNOME Opens an Official Merch Shop Selling T-Shirts, More is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Mozilla VPN Goes Live …But Not For Linux Users
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Mozilla's VPN service has officially launched in six countries, including the UK but users can't yet use the tech, which costs $4.99 a month, on Linux.

This post, Mozilla VPN Goes Live …But Not For Linux Users is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: New PinePhone with 3GB RAM and USB Dock Goes on Sale
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
The PinePhone postmarketOS Community Edition is now available to order direct from Pine64 priced at $149 — but I don’t think you should buy it. Hear me out, hear me out — there is a […]

This post, New PinePhone with 3GB RAM and USB Dock Goes on Sale is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Android 10 is Coming to the PinePhone (Updated)
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
GloDroid is a project that wants to bring a fully open source version of Android 10 to low-cost devices including the Orange Pi, PinePhone and PineTab.

This post, Android 10 is Coming to the PinePhone (Updated) is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Ubuntu Will No Longer Track Which Packages Users Install
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Ubuntu will no longer log which packages users install from the archives. The 'popularity contest' package will not ship in future versions of the distro.

This post, Ubuntu Will No Longer Track Which Packages Users Install is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Star Labs’ Newest Linux Laptop is Small But Perfectly Formed
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
The Star Labs Lite Mk III is a small, full-formed Linux laptop perfect for on-the-go computing. We share the laptop's specs, price, and where to buy.

This post, Star Labs’ Newest Linux Laptop is Small But Perfectly Formed is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: Open Folders in Any Terminal App from Nautilus
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Being able to open a folder in a terminal from Nautilus is handy — but what if you want to use a different terminal app? Use this plucky Nautilus plugin.

This post, Open Folders in Any Terminal App from Nautilus is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: RSS Fan? Check out NewsFlash Feed Reader for Linux Desktops
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
NewsFlash is a modern feed reader app for Linux desktops. Built in GTK the NewsFlash feed reader integrates nicely with the GNOME Shell desktop. Learn more.

This post, RSS Fan? Check out NewsFlash Feed Reader for Linux Desktops is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.

item.title: How to Upgrade to Linux Mint 20 (Step by Step Guide)
item.dc:creator: Joey Sneddon
item.description:
Want to upgrade Linux Mint 19.3 to 20? In this short tutorial we show you how. So put off a fresh install and upgrade to Linux Mint 20 the easy way.

This post, How to Upgrade to Linux Mint 20 (Step by Step Guide) is from OMG! Ubuntu!. Do not reproduce elsewhere without permission.
